This game makes you think outside of the box

Half-Life is a legendary First Person Shooter game.Half-Life made a difference and maybe saved the FPS genre.As you may know,before Half-Life,FPS games were a maze full of enemies and a key that the player has to find in order to progress in the game.That is the style of gameplay that made FPS games popular and because of that TOO many games came and because of no updates or new ideas the genre was starting to die.But then a legend was born and saved the day,maybe the week,month or the existence of FPS games.The legends' name,as you probably thought is Half-Life.

Half-Life runs on the Gold Source engine which gives it a unique look with great mechanics.

It has a great and long story which can keep the player in the games due to the amazing story and experience.

It has a variety of weapons which are all different from each other.

Why would you need weapons without enemies ? Answer:You don't.But now seriously,Half-Life throws a lot of enemies at you which are really well detailed.

Finally,I strongly recommend Half-Life and it's expansions.If you aren't sure,just wait for a sale and get it for 1$.

Final verdict-10/10 Would blast  Nihilanth again!

The original Half-Life is an FPS masterpiece which kickstarted a narrative and mechanical revolution that's still ongoing in the genre to this day. 

Because of its understated, minimalist plot using environmental and gameplay-based storytelling, it's aged incredibly well and still makes for a very engaging experience. The gameplay is every bit as excellent and solid as it was all those years ago, the sound design is still phenomenal and the stylized-yet-realistic art direction makes for a look that still holds up today. Buying it also gives you access to a huge, huge quantity of great quality mods developed for the game over the course of almost 20 years, and that's definitely worth the price of admission.

But looking beyond its legacy in modding, and the standard also set by later entries in the series, Half-Life is still a remarkable game and an absolute must-have.

So, it's been a while now, huh? I was a kid when Half-life was released, and of course, I've played it all through, maybe a dozen times. But only now, when I'm at the half-life age myself, with wife, two kids, a job where I need to speak to people ten hours per day... I finally got it. Every day when I don't need to speak seems like a blessing. So, people, cut your jokes about mouthless Gordon. He just chose the right job.

But, there is always a price...

Half Life is an OLD game... But it holds up pretty okay! This game may look like a piece of crap, but if you really put some time into it, you can possibly get some enjoyment out of it. 

The story is interesting, the weapons are varied and fun to use, there are many interesting mechanics, and there are a lot of parts that are fun to play through.

But there are some problems... The military enemies are not as fun to fight as the monsters, since they have perfect laser accuracy and always seem to hit you (especially the snipers), and Xen (nuff said).

If you can get this game for a very cheap price, try it out. It could be worth it!

This game, which was released in 1998 and can be considered as the ancestor of the FPS genre, has a story, mechanics, gameplay and soundtrack far ahead of its time.

It also forms the basis of the "Counter-Strike" series, one of the world's best known and played game series. I don't think so, but if you haven't played, you should definitely play right away.

You can understand why people are impatient for "Half-Life 3" when you play this game. Absolutely perfect. It's the best FPS game of all time.
卡死玩不了

Uno dei migliori FPS a cui abbia mai giocato, risploverato da poco dato che da piccolo non credo di essere mai riuscito a finirlo. Un gioco davvero sensazionale, che fa del level design il suo punto di forza. Difatti, il level design è meglio del 90% dei giochi attuali, segno che gli sviluppatori moderni hanno imparato poco o niente, continuando essi a sviluppare giochi con mappe unidirezionali e senza strade alternative, più o meno difficili. Ho avuto difficoltà giocando a normale, quindi se siete alla ricerca di qualcosa di impegnativo è particolarmente consigliato. Consigliato in generale a chiunque, è un must-have per ogni PC gamer, hardcore o meno che sia, amante degli FPS o meno che sia.

PS: ovviamente dovete aspettarvi grafica e audio datati essendo un gioco del 1998, ma questo non influisce assolutamente sul gameplay. Anzi, magari vi aiuterà a capire che la grafica, nei giochi, è solo un aspetto secondario (se non terziario).

Half-Life.
Um dos maiores fenômenos da internet e com certeza a maior franquia já feita pela Valve. O jogo trás a história de Gordon Freeman, um cientista que deve testar uma máquina de teletransporte, porém o experimento dá errado, e acaba trazendo aliens para a Terra, e Gordon os deve impedir de matar todos e dominar a Terra. Nomeado jogo do ano (1998) em 50 publicações, este game possui uma história muito boa, gráficos bons para a época lançada, e o melhor FPS dos anos 90 (Até ser ultrapassado, é claro em multiplayer somente, por Counter-Strike). Dando inicio a nova era dos FPS.


Gráficos: 9,5/10 (Bons para a época lançada, atualmente Nintendo 64)
Jogabilidade: 10/10
Comunidade: Fan Arts incríveis, vídeos incríveis, e animações INCRÍVEIS! 10/10
Dificuldade: 10/10 Pelo fato de não ter dificuldade é chato no começo mas perem desafiadora.
Nota final: 10/10

If you're looking for a great blast from the past, you could do a lot worse than getting into Half-Life. This is another game I mostly missed when I came out, so I'm not writing this out of nostalgia. This is simply a joy to play throughout, mixing tight shooting with some clever first-person puzzle design. Even the platforming sections are good, although in the latter part of the game where you enter an alien world, there are some "trampoline" spots on the floor which are supposed to launch you into the air when you step on them. However, I found them to be unreliable - sometimes they seemed to not work and required a bit of trial and error to get you in the air.

Half-Life's main claim to FPS fame is its level design - it's very tight and well-designed, showing the triple-A gaming industry of today that you don't always need an "open world" to be immersive. Cleverly designed linear paths can do the job if it is believable and has enough variety to keep you entertained, which Half-Life does very well. Another part of its level design that was revolutionary at the time and still holds up well today is how they are constructed - there are no long loading screens, cutscenes, or ludicrous splits between levels. It is all contiguous and seamless, meaning that throughout the game there are very few points that give you a feeling of complete "safety" - enemies can often reach you anywhere, and the game feels like one long sequence rather than several shoddily tied-together ones. The lack of cutscenes means the story is told through what are referred to as "scripted sequences" - meaning that in order to learn what is happening, it pays to pay attention to what is happening around you and listen to what NPCs are saying. This could be a conversation between survivors, or listening to a radio signal. I love good cutscenes - like the beautiful ones in Thief II for instance - but Half-Life shows a different way of doing things and makes it more than just a shooter.

But Half-Life IS a shooter - and thankfully the shooting is brilliant. The weapons all feel different and unique, and have their advantages and disadvantages. The AI holds up well especially for the time, knowing when to retreat and where and when to use projectile weapons - like grenades for instance. There is a satisfying variety of human and non-human opponents all with different modes of attack. There are only a couple of boss fights - the last of which is a bit weird. Both, however, are quite challenging and thankfully the levels they are designed in allow for either tactics or all-guns blazing, which is very risky. The game does not hold your hand with objective lists or mission markers, so don't miss anything important! Especially not switches - don't rush through areas just because they have no enemies! I did this once during a genuinely tense section where a set of tentacles guard a missile silo and had to go back again to turn the switches on. Oh, and make sure you do the training section at the beginning of the game - I missed this and therefore didn't know how to do a long jump three-quarters of the way through the game!

One area where the game does show its age is the limited character modelling, animation and voice acting, but then many modern games today are no better in this area. It does mean, however, that we had to wait until Half-Life 2 until we got a set of different characters that we built a relationship with and who had a set of distinct dialogue. But if you want shooter action with clever design, Half-Life still delivers. Oh, and the game is surprisingly gory and graphic - dismembered body parts fall out of broken air vents, blood spatters out of soldier's bodies, and tanks and planes blow up into smithereens. Definitely try this game if you're looking for a shooter that takes you on a challenging, continuous journey rather than just dumping you in lots of different places at a time and does most of the shooting for you.

[u]What I liked about the game[/u]
[list]
[*]	Brilliant story. A story with unexpected events and leaves many unanswered questions. 

[*]	Top-notch level design. I enjoyed exploring Black Mesa, finding secret ammunition stashes. 

[*]	Challenging, throughout the game there are many puzzles and obstacles to get past and the combat can be quite challenging as well. 

[*]	Brilliant soundtrack; Gives me goosebumps.  

[*]	A great arsenal of weapons. Some of the old weapon models have been replaced; like the pistol and machine gun.

[*]	I loved the introduction to the game and the game had a brilliant ending.  

[u]What I disliked or was disappointed with[/u]

[*]	Wasn’t keen on the final boss fight. I found the final boss fight to be a bit confusing and frustrating.  

[*]    I found myself occasionlly getting stuck on some obstacles, which was quite annoying, especially when you haven't saved the game. 

[/list]

[u]Conclusion[/u] 
This is the version to buy. It’s an absolutely fantastic game. I highly recommended it. I hope the series continue
A must buy for any fps fan.

Только вот, если вы незнакомы с движком этой игры, то я вам сочувствую. Это своеобразный маленький "мир". Разрушения в этой игре самые приятные, которые я видел. Палки, трубы, камни, древесина - все это падает с невероятной красотой. И эта красoта задевает немногих. Знаете, есть такие картины "каракули" (точного названия не знаю), где на белом фоне просто набрызгано каким-нибудь цветом непонятная "картина". Так и тут: в этих движениях можно найти какой-либо филосовский смысл, как будто вы смотрите балет. Вообщем, я как раз-таки любитель такого "искусства". 

А в общем, это просто хорошая игра.

Bienvenidos al mejor juego de la historia, si hay algo que no tiene que faltar en tu biblioteca es el Half Life. Un juego único e inigualable, que demostró y demuestra que no se nesecita tener los mejores gráficos para ser un juegazo. Debo decir que pese a sus año lo vuelvo a jugar y siento la emoción de la primera vez. Historia, trama y jugabilidad la mejor combinación con su gran variedad de armas y enemigos bien nivelados. La inteligencia es un papel importante, tu astucia y habilidad es lo primordial, sin ellos puede que mueras muchas veces.
Si nunca lo jugaste te invito a que lo pruebes y viva la experiencia de esta gran historia. 

100% de recomendación absoluta.

Half Life - определённо бессмертная классика, которая неплохо выглядит и по сей день. Мрачная атмосфера лично меня очень сильно захватывает. Играть в эту игру - одно удовольствие. Геймплей обычного шутера разнообразили головоломками, а мягкое управление делает похождения физика-теоретика с монтировкой (казалось бы) банально приятным занятием. 
Если вам вдруг не по душе графика 1998 года, то тогда играйте в переиздания - Half Life Source или Black Mesa.
А для своего времени первая халфа сделала технический прорыв и безусловно заслуживает десять монтировок из десяти.

Un clasico que todo "gamer" deberia conocer, sin importar sus graficas, tiene una jugabilidad divertida y que te srorepende y hasta te reta en ciertos aspectos, buena historia, y el iconico Gordon Freeman. must play.
If you haven't played this game, you should be ashamed of yourself.

Holly crap, this was a fun game. For an old game, it was surprisingly really fun to play. I was playing it on a crap computer and I was still getting high frames. It's first person shooter style map was one of the first I played, and I love it. I probably won it on easy in around 14 hours. Though it does have so problems. 1: Item pushing and pulling. If you push it while pressing "e," the item flys away. If you pull the item from an angle, which pulling requires "e," then it goes flying backwards. 2: Plateforming. You move so fast, that it is incredibly hard to do sometimes. Make sure that you never forget to "F6" (Quick save) and to "F7" (Quick load) EVER! You will regret it. But other wise, it is a fun, fleshed out, well made, 1990's game.

A timeless classic. This game will always be good, no matter how old it gets in time. This is where it all started for what we consider "modern" shooters. A fun story, vast array of weapons to use, nice variety of enemies to fight, good pacing, interesting puzzles, the list goes on. I use to prefer playing the source engine version because of the better lighting, phsyics, and general atmoshpere, but there is no real mechanical different. The better physics simply being that you don't go off the ground from even the slightest incline, but that's fairly negligable. Nowadays, though, you really might as well play this version because, somewhere down the line, the sourc version turned into a horribly buggy mess. I finished my first playthrough of this version in 8.3 hours, which is a nice, robust length for a game like this. It also makes it the longest the orignal "trilogy" (Half-life, Blue Shift, and Opposing Force). I don't usually say that you can't call yourself a gamer unless you've played games X, Y, and Z, but this is definitely one of those classic that EVERYONE, especially if you're a big shooter fan, should play at least once and for only $10 it's definitely worth it. Now, if you want to get all 3 of the original half life games, then do buy the Half-Life 1 Anthology which includes this, Blue Shift, and Opposing for super cheap (me paying like just under $14 for it). My only real complaint about this game is the last stretch that takes place in a world called "Xen" which is where all the aliens come from. I, personally, HATE the last stretch of this game, but I won't let that ruined the rest of it and neither should you. My reasons for hating Xen are really all my own and are 100% subjective. Buy this with the Anthology and play all 3 original Half-Life games, you won't be disappointed.
